definition: to howl with laughter/to laugh one's head off

sentences.english: It also involves howls of exasperation cursing and gnashing of teeth.
sentences.chinese: 還包括憤激的狂笑詛咒和咬牙切齒。

sentences.english: He heehawed and said everything had been arranged only by him.
sentences.chinese: 他狂笑着說所有這一切都是他一手策劃安排的。

sentences.english: The girls giggled at the joke.
sentences.chinese: 他們聽了他的笑話都一陣狂笑。

sentences.english: Paul beat his rival at last , and he guffawed boisterously.
sentences.chinese: 保羅最終戰勝他的對手，發出一陣狂笑。

sentences.english: His jokes set the table in a roar.
sentences.chinese: 他的笑話逗得整桌人狂笑不止。

sentences.english: The answer was lost in a shout of ribald laughter.
sentences.chinese: 回答被一陣下流的狂笑聲掩蓋了。

sentences.english: Osama was laughing wildly, and I didn’t want to look at his face.
sentences.chinese: 我不想看到奧薩馬開始狂笑的臉。

sentences.english: We got a fright when he suddenly guffawed .
sentences.chinese: 他突然地“狂笑”，把我們都嚇了一跳。

sentences.english: Then all three of them laughed heartily.
They all guffawed at his jokes.
sentences.chinese: 他們聽了他的笑話都一陣狂笑。

sentences.english: When the free and easy defeated retreat, the only sensitive to the laughter.
sentences.chinese: 當灑脫潰不成軍節節敗退時，只剩下敏感在狂笑。

sentences.english: We both roared with laughter, our heads together.
Look at Chloe she couldn't stop giggling when I was kissing her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 看小克我親她臉蛋兒時她狂笑不止。

sentences.english: Dad and I guffaw at the same time.
A 50 year-old English, died due to fatal hilarity.
sentences.chinese: 一名50歲的英國人，死於致命狂笑。

sentences.english: But then he realizes he's forgotten how to tear paper, throw paper, or laugh maniacally.
sentences.chinese: 過了一會，他甚至不知道怎麼去撕紙了或怎麼狂笑了。

definition: to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
very loudly/at the top of one's voice
to face upwards/to look up to the sky
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
